meanings.definition: To take the place of (someone or something previously in authority or use)
meanings.sent1: The new manager is superseding the old one.
meanings.sent2: The digital clock superseded the old analog one.
meanings.sent3: The young prince superseded his father as the ruler, causing a royal commotion.
meanings.sent4: Technology is superseding traditional methods at a rapid pace.
meanings.sent5: The rising sun superseded the darkness, bringing a new day.

meanings.sent1: She is superseding the old carpet with a new one.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to supersede the outdated software with a more advanced version.
meanings.sent3: The cat superseded the worn-out toy with a shiny new one.
meanings.sent4: His laughter superseded the silence in the room, bringing joy to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers superseded the dull landscape, adding beauty to the garden.
